articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Olena Harmash
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy pored over a once-classified map of vast deposits of rare earths and other critical minerals during an interview with Reuters on Friday, part of a push to appeal to Donald Trump's penchant for a deal.
articles.title: Exclusive: Zelenskiy says 'Let's do a deal', offering Trump mineral partnership, seeking security

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian militant group Hamas is set to hand over three Israeli hostages on Saturday in exchange for Palestinian detainees and prisoners in the latest stage of a ceasefire deal aimed at opening the way to ending the 15-month war in Gaza.
articles.title: Hamas set to release three Israeli hostages as Gaza ceasefire holds

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg, Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: International Criminal Court Prosecutor Karim Khan is the first person to be hit with economic and travel sanctions authorized by U.S. President Donald Trump that target the war crimes tribunal over investigations of U.S. citizens or U.S. allies, two sources briefed on the matter told Reuters on Friday.
articles.title: War crimes prosecutor first target of Trump's ICC sanctions, sources say

articles.author: Nivedita Balu
articles.description: Canada could face long-term political challenges with the United States even if it manages to avert U.S. President Donald Trump's threat of tariffs, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Friday.
articles.title: Canada could face long-term political challenges with US, says Trudeau

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: A U.S. judge will consider on Friday whether to temporarily block the Trump administration from dismantling the U.S. Agency for International Development and carrying out plans to put thousands of its workers globally on administrative leave at midnight.
articles.title: US judge to weigh blocking Trump from dismantling USAID

articles.author: Rich McKay, Brad Brooks
articles.description: The U.S. Coast Guard in Alaska on Friday found the wreckage of a small plane that suddenly lost altitude on Thursday and went missing with 10 people on board, recovering three of the bodies.
articles.title: Coast Guard finds missing Alaska plane; 3 bodies of 10 on board recovered

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China expressed regret on Saturday over Panama's intention to leave Beijing's Belt and Road Initiative, urging the Latin American nation to "make the right decision".
articles.title: China urges Panama to 'make right decision' after announcing Belt and Road exit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. State Department has approved the potential sales of missiles, munitions and other equipment to Israel for an estimated total of about $7.4 billion, the Pentagon said on Friday.
articles.title: US State Department approves military sales worth $7.4 billion to Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has postponed a phone call with Panamanian President Jose Raul Mulino due to last-minute changes in the U.S. leader's agenda, Panama's government said on Friday, amid tensions over U.S. threats to take over the Panama Canal.
articles.title: Trump postpones call with Panama's president as canal tensions simmer

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said President Donald Trump supported the AUKUS nuclear submarine deal, after Australia on Friday confirmed its first $500 million payment under the defense pact.
articles.title: Trump aware, supportive of AUKUS pact, US defense secretary says
